metadata.title: CVE-2017-8765 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
The function named ReadICONImage in coders\icon.c in ImageMagick 7.0.5-5has a memory leak vulnerability which can cause memory exhaustion via acrafted ICON file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8765` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.7').
